meanings.definition: Able to be abused or mistreated.
meanings.sent1: The poor animal was in an abusable situation.
meanings.sent2: It is important to protect children from abusable environments.
meanings.sent3: The abusable toy was quickly broken by the rough child.
meanings.sent4: Her trust was like an abusable fragile glass, easily shattered.
meanings.sent5: The abusable nature of the old building was evident in its crumbling walls.

meanings.sent1: The abusable system was prone to errors.
meanings.sent2: The elderly are often seen as abusable targets for scams.
meanings.sent3: The abusable loophole in the law was exploited by the cunning lawyer.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an abusable quality that some took advantage of.
meanings.sent5: The abusable nature of the internet makes it important to stay vigilant online.
